en: She can do 90 miles an hour.
zh: 她那车时速能开到90英里。

en: I will be back in an hour.
zh: 我一个小时后回来。

en: I must finish my homework in an hour.
zh: 我必须在一个小时内写完作业。

en: I'll finish it in one hour.
zh: 我一小时就能搞定。

en: It is hard to get through the work in an hour.
zh: 一个小时内要干完这活儿挺难的。

en: I got warm from jogging for an hour.
zh: 慢跑了一个小时，身上暖和多了。

en: I will come to you in an hour.
zh: 我一个小时后去找你。

en: I will call you in an hour.
zh: 我一个小时后给你打电话。

en: I'll be back in an hour or so.
zh: 我大概一个小时左右回来。

en: I'm afraid he won't be here until 1:00.
zh: 我怕他得一点钟才能到。

en: Let's meet at one o'clock.
zh: 我们一点钟见。

en: A new dictionary has been projected.
zh: 编写新词典的计划已经在筹备中了。

en: Put a word in parentheses.
zh: 把一个词加在括号里。

en: January is usually the coldest month.
zh: 一月通常是最冷的月份。

en: We expected that we should have a warm January, but we hear that this winter is the coldest in twenty years.
zh: 我们本以为一月会挺暖和，结果听说这是二十年来最冷的一个冬天。

en: Exports in January were up 20% over the same period of last year.
zh: 一月份的出口额比去年同期增长了20%。

en: Exports in January totalled $10 billion, a record for the month.
zh: 一月份出口总额达100亿美元，创下了该月的纪录。

en: The price in January advanced 20% year to year.
zh: 一月份的价格同比上涨了20%。

en: Thank you very much for your letter of January 7th.
zh: 非常感谢你1月7号的来信。

en: From the 5th to the 15th of January, please.
zh: 请定在1月5号到15号。

en: For three nights starting January 3rd, please.
zh: 请从1月3号开始订三晚。

en: I'm taking bereavement leave on Jan. 30 and 31.
zh: 我1月30号和31号要请丧假。

en: Here are the proposed agenda items for the meeting on January 28.
zh: 这是1月28号会议的拟定议程。

en: We'll release the final agenda on the morning of Monday, January 20, so please reply quickly.
zh: 我们会在1月20号周一早上发布最终议程，所以请尽快回复。

en: January 1st is a day when many Japanese go to the shrine.
zh: 1月1号是很多日本人去神社的日子。

en: The all-day DTA Technical meeting on Tuesday Jan 14 was attended by 32 people from 18 DTA firms.
zh: 1月14号周二的全天DTA技术会议有来自18家DTA公司的32人参加。

en: The first term starts in April.
zh: 第一学期四月开学。

en: Did you receive my e-mail of January 10?
zh: 你收到我1月10号发的邮件了吗？

en: My grades have improved since first semester.
zh: 自第一学期以来，我的成绩提高了。

en: I'd like seats on the first floor.
zh: 我想要一楼的座位。

en: The downstairs was rented to a bookseller.
zh: 楼下租给了一个卖书的。

en: I succeeded in my first attempt.
zh: 我第一次尝试就成功了。

en: I can't afford to waste a single yen.
zh: 我一分钱都不能浪费。

en: A bird flew into the tree.
zh: 一只鸟飞进树丛里了。

en: A bird was flying in the sky.
zh: 天上有一只鸟在飞。

en: A yard is equal to three feet.
zh: 一码等于三英尺。

en: A meter is not quite equivalent to a yard.
zh: 一米不完全等于一码。

en: A metre is 100 centimetres.
zh: 一米是100厘米。

en: Begin to write, leaving one space blank.
zh: 开始写吧，留出一个空格。

en: I had hardly walked a mile when it began to thunder.
zh: 我还没走出一英里就开始打雷了。

en: I had not gone a mile when it began to rain.
zh: 我还没走出一英里就开始下雨了。

en: A mile is equal to about 1600 meters.
zh: 一英里大约等于1600米。

en: A penny saved is a penny earned.
zh: 省一分就是赚一分。

en: There is a page missing.
zh: 缺了一页。

en: Please make three copies of each page.
zh: 请把每一页都复印三份。

en: Can you spare a buck?
zh: 能借我一块钱吗？

en: Do you have any ones?
zh: 你有几张一块的吗？

en: Could you give me change for a dollar?
zh: 能帮我换开一美元吗？

en: One dollar is equivalent to 110 yen.
zh: 一美元等于110日元。

en: A dollar is equal to a hundred cents.
zh: 一美元等于一百美分。

en: I was fined a dollar.
zh: 我被罚了一块钱。

en: I don't have a cent, let alone a dollar.
zh: 我一分钱都没有，更别说一块钱了。

en: Have you got change for a dollar?
zh: 你有一块钱零钱吗？

en: Give me $1.00 back, please.
zh: 请退给我一块钱。

en: I'd like to ask a question.
zh: 我想问个问题。

en: I found them all but one.
zh: 除了一个，其他的我都找到了。

en: I can afford one, but not both.
zh: 我买得起一个，但买不起两个。

en: Why don't we share a room?
zh: 咱们合住一个房间怎么样？

en: Every time a species dies out, we lose forever a part of our natural world.
zh: 每当一个物种灭绝，我们就会永远失去自然界的一部分。

en: Just as one gesture can have many different meanings, many different gestures can have the same meaning.
zh: 就像一个手势可以有很多种意思，很多不同的手势也可以是同一个意思。

en: For one thing, I am busy; for another, I have no money.
zh: 一来我很忙，二来我没钱。

en: For one thing, I'm busy; for another, I'm not interested.
zh: 一方面我很忙，另一方面我没兴趣。

en: For one thing I have no money; for another I haven't the time.
zh: 一是因为我没钱，二是因为我没时间。

en: No sooner has one typhoon passed than the next one approaches.
zh: 一个台风刚走，下一个就来了。

en: A pair of canaries are her only friends.
zh: 一对金丝雀是她仅有的朋友。

en: Rows of houses, each of them different and pleasing with their spacious gardens, are replaced by purely functional blocks of flats which have nothing more to commend them than over-praised 'modern conveniences'.
zh: 那一排排各有千秋、带大花园的房子，全都被换成了那种只讲功能、没啥优点，就知道吹嘘“现代生活设施”的公寓楼。

en: We will have to consider each application on a case-by-case basis.
zh: 我们得根据具体情况逐一考虑每一份申请。

en: Nine players make up a team.
zh: 九名球员组成一个队。

en: A team is composed of eleven players.
zh: 一个队由十一名球员组成。

en: It is cheaper to order by the dozen.
zh: 按打买更便宜。

en: If we had been in Venice a month prior, we could have taken part in the carnival.
zh: 如果我们早一个月在威尼斯，就能参加狂欢节了。

en: I don't mind lending you the money provided you pay it back within a month.
zh: 只要你一个月内还，我可以把钱借给你。

en: Come back within a month.
zh: 一个月之内回来。

en: A month has passed and the work has made little progress.
zh: 一个月过去了，工作几乎没什么进展。

en: We cannot live on 150000 yen a month.
zh: 每月十五万日元我们没法生活。

en: It's impossible to learn English in a month.
zh: 一个月学会英语是不可能的。

en: Count from one to ten.
zh: 从一数到十。

en: Give him an inch and he will take a yard.
zh: 得寸进尺。

en: Does the 19 bus go to Main Street?
zh: 19路车去主街吗？

en: Not until the end of the nineteenth century, did plant breeding become a scientific discipline.
zh: 直到十九世纪末，植物育种才成为一门科学学科。

en: Even at the end of the nineteenth century, sailors in the British Navy were not permitted to use knives and forks because using them was considered a sign of weakness.
zh: 甚至到了十九世纪末，英国海军的船员还不被允许使用刀叉，因为那被看作是软弱的表现。

en: The nineteenth century was the age of the white man's civilization.
zh: 十九世纪是白人文明的时代。

en: During the 19th century, many inventions were developed.
zh: 十九世纪出现了很多发明。

en: The 19th century saw the Industrial Revolution.
zh: 工业革命发生在十九世纪。

en: In the 19th century, the number of immigrants swelled rapidly.
zh: 十九世纪移民人数迅速增加。

en: I am 19 years old.
zh: 我十九岁了。

en: Subway fares will be raised as of April 1st, 1999.
zh: 地铁票价将从1999年4月1日起上调。

en: Japan's exports exceeded imports by $77.8 billion in 1998.
zh: 1998年日本出口额比进口额多了778亿美元。

en: Here is the demand forecast for 1998.
zh: 这是1998年的需求预测。

en: Here are the proposed agenda items for the meeting on June 16, 1998.
zh: 这是1998年6月16日会议的拟议议程。

en: Please settle this account by October 28, 1998.
zh: 请在1998年10月28日前结清这笔账。

en: In 1997, the world was surprised again when Mother Teresa died.
zh: 1997年特蕾莎修女去世，全世界再次感到震惊。

en: In 1995, Andou received architecture's most prestigious award.
zh: 安藤在1995年获得了建筑界最负盛名的奖项。

en: In 1994, there was a shortage of water and rice in Japan.
zh: 1994年日本缺水缺大米。

en: The Conservative Party won the election in 1992.
zh: 保守党在1992年的选举中获胜。

en: There were twice as many university applicants in 1992 as in 1982.
zh: 1992年的大学报考人数是1982年的两倍。

en: As of 1991, the population of this city is around one million.
zh: 截至1991年，这座城市的人口大约有一百万。

en: The 1990s began with the Gulf War.
zh: 20世纪90年代以海湾战争拉开了序幕。

en: Technology will make a lot of progress in the nineties.
zh: 九十年代科技会有很大的进步。

en: The 1990s began with the Gulf incident.
zh: 20世纪90年代是从海湾事件开始的。

en: 1990 saw many incidents.
zh: 1990年出了很多事。

en: What were the chief events of 1990?
zh: 1990年主要发生了哪些大事？

en: I haven't seen Tom since 1988.
zh: 1988年以后我就没见过汤姆了。

en: One October morning in 1987, Stephen Hawking sat before his computer.
zh: 1987年10月的一个早晨，史蒂芬·霍金坐在他的电脑前。

en: It happened that in August, 1984 my work obliged me to go to Okinawa.
zh: 碰巧1984年8月我因为工作得去一趟冲绳。

en: 1980 was the year when I was born.
zh: 我是1980年出生的。

en: The year 1980 saw the fastest economic growth in that country.
zh: 那个国家在1980年的经济增长最快。

en: In 1979, Mother Teresa won the Nobel Peace Prize.
zh: 1979年，特蕾莎修女获得了诺贝尔和平奖。

en: In 1978 a peace treaty was concluded between Japan and China.
zh: 1978年中日签署了和平友好条约。

en: In 1972, Dr. Francine Patterson started to teach sign language to Koko.
zh: 1972年，弗朗辛·帕特森博士开始教大猩猩可可手语。

en: In the automotive industry of the 1970's, Japan beat the U.S. at its own game.
zh: 在70年代的汽车工业中，日本在竞争中击败了美国。

en: In April of 1968, Rev. King was in Memphis, Tennessee.
zh: 1968年4月，马丁·路德·金牧师在田纳西州的孟菲斯。

en: In 1964, Rev. King won the Nobel Peace Prize.
zh: 1964年，马丁·路德·金牧师获得了诺贝尔和平奖。

en: In the 1960's, Japanese college students demonstrated against their government.
zh: 20世纪60年代，日本大学生举行了反对政府的示威游行。

en: There were demonstrations against the government by Japanese university students in the 1960's.
zh: 20世纪60年代，日本大学生发动了反对政府的示威。

en: In 1958, the statue was built in the Hiroshima Peace Park.
zh: 1958年，广岛和平纪念公园里建起了那座雕像。

en: In 1955, the cancer returned and she died in 1956 at the age of 42.
zh: 1955年她的癌症复发了，1956年去世，年仅42岁。

en: In 1951, Sister Teresa was sent to Calcutta, then the largest city in India.
zh: 1951年，特蕾莎修女被派往加尔各答，那是当时印度最大的城市。

en: An atomic bomb was dropped on Hiroshima in 1945.
zh: 1945年，一颗原子弹投在了广岛。

en: In 1943, Japan was at war.
zh: 1943年，日本正处于战争中。

en: I was not yet born when a war between Japan and the U.S. broke out in December 1941.
zh: 1941年12月日美战争爆发时，我还没出生呢。

en: War broke out in 1941.
zh: 1941年爆发了战争。

en: In 1939, as in 1914, the world was on the brink of war.
zh: 1939年就像1914年一样，世界处于战争的边缘。

en: The year 1932 found him in Paris.
zh: 1932年那会儿他在巴黎。

en: During the Depression in the 1930's, many wealthy people lost everything in the stock market crash.
zh: 在20世纪30年代大萧条时期，股市崩盘让很多富人变得一无所有。

en: Mexican desperadoes during the early twenties were usually armed to the teeth with stolen firearms and ammunition.
zh: 20世纪20年代初的墨西哥匪徒通常全副武装，带着偷来的枪支弹药。

en: Japan has been sending her athletes to the Olympics since 1912.
zh: 自1912年以来，日本一直派运动员参加奥运会。

en: One day in 1906, a newspaper cartoonist named Tad Dorgan went to a baseball game.
zh: 1906年的某一天，一位名叫塔德·多根的报纸漫画家去看了场棒球赛。

en: In 1900, he left England, and he never returned.
zh: 1900年他离开了英国，再也没回来。

en: Fashion in the eighteenth century emphasized the bosom.
zh: 18世纪的时尚强调的是胸部线条。

en: In the late eighteenth century, a passport for an American was usually signed by the President of the United States.
zh: 18世纪末，美国人的护照通常由美国总统签署。

en: Children under 18 are not admitted.
zh: 18岁以下禁止入内。

en: Entrance is restricted to those above 18.
zh: 只有18岁以上才能进入。

en: People above 18 may drive.
zh: 18岁以上可以开车。

en: Anyone over eighteen years of age counts as an adult.
zh: 满18岁就算成年人了。

en: People under eighteen aren't supposed to buy alcoholic drinks.
zh: 18岁以下的人不该买酒。

en: I learned to drive a car and got a driver's license when I was eighteen.
zh: 我18岁学会了开车，还拿到了驾照。

en: Now that you are 18 years old, you should not do such a thing.
zh: 既然你已经18岁了，就不该做这种事。

en: If he could pass for eighteen years old, he'd join the army.
zh: 如果他能冒充成18岁，他就会去参军。

en: In 1860, Lincoln was elected President of the United States.
zh: 1860年，林肯当选为美国总统。

en: In 1853, the first blue jeans came out.
zh: 1853年，第一条蓝色牛仔裤面世了。

en: In 1853, Perry asked Japan to open the door to America.
zh: 1853年，佩里要求日本对美国开放国门。

en: Between 1820 and 1973, the United States admitted more than 46 million immigrants.
zh: 在1820年到1973年间，美国接收了超过4600万移民。

en: Hanson is wrong when he states international economic developments led to great migrations of labour in the seventeenth century.
zh: 汉森说17世纪国际经济的发展导致了大规模的劳动力迁移，这观点是错的。

en: A boy of seventeen is often as tall as his father.
zh: 17岁的男孩经常长得和他爸爸一样高了。

en: Children of age sixteen and under will not be admitted to the theatre.
zh: 16岁及以下儿童不得进入剧院。

en: When I was sixteen, I played tennis for the first time.
zh: 我16岁的时候第一次打网球。

en: After 1639 Japan closed the door to foreign cuisine.
zh: 1639年以后，日本不再允许外国饮食进入。

en: In 1603, when King James I came into power, football was allowed again.
zh: 1603年，当詹姆斯一世国王执政时，足球再次被允许了。

en: In the 1600s, tea was introduced into Europe from India.
zh: 17世纪的时候，茶叶从印度传入了欧洲。

en: Do you think you can get me to Union Station by a quarter after?
zh: 你看能在15分之前把我送到联合车站吗？

en: Since graduation fifteen years ago I have never run into my former classmates.
zh: 毕业十五年了，我一次都没碰到过以前的同学。

en: It was a satisfactory arrangement for fifteen years.
zh: 这十五年里，这个安排一直挺让人满意的。

en: The fine arts flourished in Italy in the 15th century.
zh: 十五世纪的时候，艺术在意大利非常繁荣。

en: There are over 15 different kinds of pies.
zh: 这里有十五种以上的派。

en: When I was fifteen, I got a room of my own.
zh: 我十五岁的时候，有了自己的房间。

en: Is it next to impossible to live to be 150?
zh: 活到150岁几乎是不可能的吧？

en: It is said that Friday the 13th is an unlucky day.
zh: 据说13号星期五是个不吉利的日子。

en: A few days after his thirteenth birthday, Tony left school, too.
zh: 13岁生日刚过几天，托尼也退学了。

en: When she was thirteen, she ran away from home.
zh: 她十三岁那年离家出走了。

en: As is often the case with 13 to 19 year olds, she fell in love.
zh: 就像那个年纪的青少年常有的那样，她恋爱了。

en: Some people say thirteen is an unlucky number.
zh: 有人说13是个不吉利的数字。

en: Are there enough chairs to seat 12 people?
zh: 这里的椅子够十二个人坐吗？

en: Twelve musicians constitute the society.
zh: 这个协会由十二名音乐家组成。

en: How about 12:45?
zh: 十二点四十五分怎么样？

en: I shall never forget your kindness no matter where I may go.
zh: 无论我走到哪，我都不会忘记你的恩情。

en: I could swim across the river when I was twelve.
zh: 我十二岁的时候就能游过这条河了。

en: Twelve years is old for a dog.
zh: 对狗来说，十二岁已经很高龄了。

en: Many boys and girls ranging from 12 to 18 entered the contest.
zh: 许多12到18岁的青少年参加了这次比赛。

en: His voice broke when he was twelve.
zh: 他十二岁的时候变声了。

en: Don't you think it is rather warm for December?
zh: 你不觉得十二月这种天气算挺暖和的吗？

en: Twelve is an even number.
zh: 十二是个偶数。

en: The sum of 12, 24, 7 and 11 is 54.
Has Flight 123 arrived?
zh: 123航班到了吗？

en: Has Flight 123 been delayed?
zh: 123航班延误了吗？

en: You want the Number 11. It stops in front of the post office.
zh: 你要坐11路车，它停在邮局门口。

en: It's almost half past eleven.
zh: 快到十一点半了。

en: It is a little after a quarter to eleven.
zh: 刚过十点四十五。

en: It is close to eleven. It's about time we went to bed.
zh: 快十一点了，我们该睡觉了。

en: In 11 hours, we will arrive in San Francisco around 7:30.
zh: 11个小时后，也就是大概7点半，我们会到旧金山。

en: After 11 o'clock the guests began to leave by twos and threes.
zh: 十一点以后，客人们开始三三两两地离开了。

en: You can go out, as long as you promise to be back by 11 o'clock.
zh: 你可以出去，只要你答应十一点前回来。

en: I barely managed to finish the letter by eleven o'clock.
zh: 我好不容易赶在十一点前把这封信写完了。

en: I'm catching the 11:00 train.
zh: 我要赶十一点那班火车。

en: I go to bed at eleven.
zh: 我十一点睡觉。

en: Come and see me at eleven o'clock.
zh: 十一点的时候来找我。

en: It's already eleven. It's high time you were in bed.
zh: 都十一点了，你早该上床睡觉了。

en: Eleven o'clock is good for me.
zh: 十一点对我来说挺合适的。

en: We'll be home at about 11:00.
zh: 我们大概十一点左右到家。

en: Be at the station at eleven on the dot.
zh: 十一点整准时到车站。

en: I want to catch the 11:45.
zh: 我想赶十一点四十五的那班车。

en: It is ten minutes before eleven.
zh: 还有十分钟就十一点了。

en: It gets cold day by day in November.
zh: 到了十一月，天气一天比一天冷了。

en: I would like to attend the party on November 1st.
zh: 我想参加十一月一号的聚会。

en: The map on page 11 looks very strange. Turn it upside down. Then it becomes a familiar map to you.
zh: 第11页的地图看起来很奇怪。把它倒过来，你就觉得眼熟了。

en: Please refer to page ten.
zh: 请看第十页。

en: After ten minutes' walk we came to the museum.
zh: 走了十分钟后，我们就到了博物馆。

en: Ten minutes' walk brought me to the station.
zh: 走过去车站只需要十分钟。

en: Ten minutes' walk brought us to the bus stop.
zh: 走了十分钟，我们就到了公交车站。

en: Someone called on you ten minutes ago.
zh: 十分钟前有人来找过你。

en: She left home ten minutes ago.
zh: 她十分钟前出门了。

en: After ten minutes, they passed on to a new topic.
zh: 过了十分钟，他们换了个新话题。

en: Let's take a 10 minute break.
zh: 咱们休息十分钟吧。

en: After a ten-minute break, we resumed our rehearsal.
zh: 休息了十分钟后，我们又继续排练了。

en: Let's have a ten-minute break.
zh: 我们休息十分钟。

en: I had not waited ten minutes before Mary came.
zh: 我还没等够十分钟玛丽就来了。

en: He'll be along in ten minutes.
zh: 他十分钟后就到。

en: You'll get there in less than ten minutes.
zh: 你不到十分钟就能到那儿。

en: I'll be back in ten minutes.
zh: 我十分钟后回来。

en: I arrived at the station ten minutes late.
zh: 我迟到了十分钟才到车站。

en: Ten years ago the ward office gave us ballpoint pens on the Coming of Age Day.
zh: 十年前的成人礼，区公所发了圆珠笔给我们。

en: Kyowa Bank and Saitama Bank merged into Asahi Bank ten years ago.
zh: 协和银行和埼玉银行十年前合并成了朝日银行。

en: There was a deep pond there ten years ago.
zh: 十年前那里有个深水潭。

en: Ten years ago his theory would not have been generally accepted.
zh: 十年前，他的理论还不会被普遍接受。

en: Ten years ago, such business would have been a success.
zh: 要是十年前，这种生意肯定能成功。

en: There used to be a small bridge over the river 10 years ago.
zh: 十年前这条河上有一座小桥。

en: This is the worst storm in ten years.
zh: 这是十年来最猛烈的一场风暴。

en: He saw his home-town again only after ten years.
zh: 时隔十年，他才又见到了家乡。

en: In ten years our town will change a lot.
zh: 十年后，我们镇会有很大变化。

en: Suppose there was a worldwide oil shortage in ten years' time. What would happen to the industrialised countries?
zh: 假设十年后全球石油短缺，那些工业化国家会怎么样？

en: I hope I'll have learned a great deal about it in ten years.
zh: 我希望十年后我能对这方面有很深的了解。

en: I left Japan for the first time in ten years.
zh: 我十年来头一回离开日本。

en: He returned home for the first time in ten years.
zh: 他时隔十年第一次回家。

en: Ten years is a long time.
zh: 十年是一段很长的时间。

en: Ten years is a short time when we look back at it.
zh: 回头看的话，十年其实挺短的。

en: Ten years have gone by.
zh: 十年已经过去了。

en: Ten days passed by.
zh: 十天过去了。

en: It rained for the first time in ten days.
zh: 隔了十天终于下雨了。

en: There were ten accidents in as many days.
zh: 十天里出了十起事故。

en: The teenage friends stayed up talking all night.
zh: 那几个十几岁的小伙伴聊了一整晚没睡。

en: During my early teens, I was not always on the best of terms with my parents.
zh: 我十几岁出头那会儿，跟父母关系不怎么好。

en: Teenagers must adapt to today's harsh realities.
zh: 青少年必须适应如今残酷的现实。

en: Do you have a tatami room for ten people?
zh: 你们这儿有能住十个人的榻榻米房吗？

en: Three out of ten persons have a video.
zh: 十个人里有三个有录像机。

en: It can accommodate as many as ten people.
zh: 这儿最多能住十个人。

en: As many as ten people saw the accident.
zh: 多达十个人目击了那场事故。

en: As many as ten people live in this small house.
zh: 这间小房子里竟然住了十个人。

en: As many as ten students stood up all at once.
zh: 足足有十个学生一下子都站了起来。

en: As many as ten students failed the exam.
zh: 竟然有十个学生考试没及格。

en: Ten prisoners broke out of jail.
zh: 十个囚犯越狱了。

en: Ten policemen were assigned to patrol that area.
zh: 派了十个警察在那片区域巡逻。

en: I'm going to take the 10:30 train.
zh: 我打算坐十点半那班火车。

en: You must be back before ten.
zh: 你十点前必须回来。

en: We must leave the hotel before 10 a.m., otherwise we will miss the train for Miami.
zh: 我们得在上午十点前离开酒店，不然就赶不上开往迈阿密的火车了。

en: The fog began to disappear around ten o'clock.
zh: 雾在十点左右开始散了。

en: Don't call me up after ten o'clock.
zh: 十点以后别给我打电话。

en: Breakfast will not be served after ten o'clock.
zh: 十点以后就不供应早餐了。

en: I'll come by 10.
zh: 我十点前到。

en: See that dinner is ready by ten.
zh: 记得在十点前把晚饭准备好。

en: On condition you are back by ten o'clock, you may go to the dance.
zh: 只要你十点前回来，你就可以去参加舞会。

en: You must be back by 10 o'clock.
zh: 你十点前得回来。

en: I'll stay here until ten.
zh: 我会在这儿待到十点。

en: He leaves Osaka for Tokyo at ten.
zh: 他十点离开大阪去东京。

en: I'll be back at ten.
zh: 我十点回来。

en: I have a previous engagement at ten.
zh: 我十点已经约了人了。

en: Come at ten o'clock sharp.
zh: 十点准时过来。

en: We got through the work just before ten.
zh: 我们在十点前刚忙完。

en: It's ten o'clock sharp.
zh: 正好十点。

en: It's open ten to six daily throughout the year.
zh: 全年每天十点到六点营业。

en: We have a break from 10:40 to 11:00.
zh: 我们十点四十到十一点休息。

en: It is twenty minutes past ten.
zh: 十点二十了。

en: He is very clever for a boy of ten.
zh: 对一个十岁的孩子来说，他挺聪明的。

en: I had not seen a lion before I was ten years old.
zh: 我十岁以前没见过狮子。

en: Ten houses were burned down.
zh: 十间房子被烧毁了。

en: Please refer to paragraph ten.
zh: 请看第十段。

en: Only five instead of ten units were delivered.
zh: 本该送十件的，结果只送了五件。

en: The fire burnt ten houses down.
zh: 大火烧毁了十间房子。

en: One day in October, when Sadako awoke, she found her mother crying.
zh: 十月的一天，佐佐子醒来时发现她妈妈在哭。

en: There was a suggestion that the general meeting should take place in October.
zh: 有人建议全体会议在十月份举行。

en: We have a lot of very fine days in October.
zh: 十月份有很多大晴天。

en: Indian summers run into October.
zh: 秋老虎一直持续到了十月。

en: It's the third of October.
zh: 今天是十月三号。

en: Read Lesson 10 from the beginning.
zh: 从头读一下第十课。

en: Let's start with Lesson Ten.
zh: 我们从第十课开始吧。

en: One billion people speak English.
zh: 全球有十亿人在说英语。

en: I bought five ten-yen stamps.
zh: 我买了五张十日元的邮票。

en: Can I make a phone call for ten yen?
zh: 花十日元能打个电话吗？

en: Ten miles is not a short distance.
zh: 十英里可不短。

en: Look at the notes on page 10.
zh: 看一下第十页的注释。

en: Let's begin with the fifth line on page 10.
zh: 我们从第十页第五行开始。

en: Give me five tens and the rest in ones.
zh: 给我五张十块的，剩下的都要一块的。

en: In ten-dollar bills, please.
zh: 麻烦都要十块一张的。

en: I don't want to spend more than $10.
zh: 我不想花超过十块钱。

en: I'd like a money order for ten dollars.

en: We divided ten dollars among the five of us.
zh: 我们五个人分了十块钱。

en: Can you lower the price to ten dollars?

en: What is on Channel 10?
zh: 十频道在演什么？

en: Ten teams competed for the prize.
zh: 有十支队伍在争夺奖项。

en: Can you lend me a dime?
zh: 能借我一毛钱硬币吗？

en: Ten dimes are equal to one dollar.
zh: 十个一毛等于一块。

en: After an absence of ten months, he returned home.
zh: 离开了十个月后，他回家了。

en: Subtract two from ten and you have eight.
zh: 十减二等于八。

en: Two from ten leaves eight.
zh: 十减二剩八。

en: Count from 10 down to zero.
zh: 从十倒数到零。

en: Where is Room 105?
zh: 105房间在哪？

en: Call the operator at 104 then.
zh: 那就打104找接线员吧。

en: I have a fever of 102 degrees.
zh: 我发烧到102度了。

en: There's many a slip between the cup and the lip.
zh: 事情不到最后总会有变数。

en: Supposing you had one million yen, what would you do with it?
zh: 假如你有一百万日元，你会拿它干嘛？

en: If you won a million yen, what would you do?
zh: 要是你中了一百万日元，你会做什么？

en: I don't know how things were a hundred or fifty years ago.
zh: 我不知道一百年前或五十年前是什么样子的。

en: There were almost 100 people, few of whom I had seen before.
zh: 差不多有一百个人，里面没几个是我以前见过的。

en: Few people live to be one hundred years old.
zh: 很少有人能活到一百岁。

en: He can run 100 meters within twelve seconds.
zh: 他百米能跑进12秒。

en: Could you give me change out of a hundred-dollar bill?
zh: 这一百块钱你能帮我换开吗？

en: Debit Mr Hill with $100.
zh: 从希尔先生的账上扣掉100块。

en: One hundred dollars is just chicken feed.
zh: 一百块钱根本不算什么。

en: I'm wondering how long $100 will carry me.
zh: 我在想这一百块钱能让我撑多久。

en: One hundred dollars will cover all your expenses for the trip.
zh: 一百块钱够付你这次旅行的所有开销了。

en: With a hundred dollars, I could manage.
zh: 有了一百块钱，我就能应付了。

en: One hundred cents makes one dollar.
zh: 一百美分等于一美元。

en: More than 1000 issues are listed on the stock exchange.
zh: 证券交易所上市的股票有一千多种。

en: No less than 1,000 people came to the party.
zh: 来了不下于一千人参加派对。

en: Could you break a 1,000 yen note?

en: Is one thousand yen enough?
zh: 一千日元够吗？

en: You can buy it for a thousand yen or so.
zh: 一千日元左右就能买到了。

en: A thousand dollars is a large sum.
zh: 一千块钱是一大笔钱。

en: One thousand dollars will cover all the expenses for the party.
zh: 一千块钱够付派对的所有开销了。

en: Suppose you had a thousand dollars, what would you do with it?
zh: 假如你有一千块钱，你会拿来干什么？

en: One, three, and five are odd numbers.
zh: 一、三、五是奇数。

en: It is hard to master it in a year or two.
zh: 一两年内很难掌握它。

en: A thousand yen will do.
zh: 一千日元就行。

en: Please move to the rear of the bus.
zh: 请往车厢后部走。

en: Move along now.
zh: 往前走走，别停下。

en: No Trespassing.
zh: 禁止入内。

en: "Watch out for the trap!" she screamed.
zh: “小心陷阱！”她尖叫道。

en: Can you make the deadline?
zh: 你能赶上截止日期吗？

en: "Is the essay ready?" "No, I'm sorry. I haven't finished writing it yet."
zh: “文章准备好了吗？”“还没，不好意思，还没写完。”

en: "I'd rather get the sack than not join the labour union," said the disgruntled worker.
zh: “我宁愿被炒鱿鱼也要加入工会，”那个不满的工人说道。

en: You could see the elation in the president's face when he announced that our shares are going to be listed on the First Section of the TSE next year.
zh: 当社长宣布我们的股票明年要在东京证交所主板上市时，他脸上的兴奋劲儿一眼就能看出来。

en: Come, Jesus replied.
zh: 耶稣回答说：“来吧。”

en: "Will you study after dinner?" "Yes, I will."
zh: “你晚饭后会学习吗？”“会。”

en: Write an essay on "Friendship".
zh: 写一篇以“友谊”为题的作文。

en: "Animals in the wild are not robots," she says.
zh: 她说：“野外的动物可不是机器人。”

en: "Come back!" he shouted.
zh: “回来！”他大喊道。

en: "Shut up," he whispered.
zh: “闭嘴，”他小声说。

en: "Will it rain tomorrow?" "I hope not."
zh: “明天会下雨吗？”“希望不会。”

en: "Will you play the piano tomorrow?" "No, I won't."
zh: “你明天弹钢琴吗？”“不弹。”

en: Yesterday the teacher said to us, "I'll give you a test tomorrow."
zh: 老师昨天对我们说：“明天要考试。”

en: "This brand is very mild," Dad said.
zh: “这个牌子味道很淡，”爸爸说。

en: I want beef, too.
zh: 我也要牛肉。

en: "Are you sure you want to call the police?" I asked her.
zh: “你确定要报警吗？”我问她。

en: "I'm not good at swimming." "Neither am I."
zh: “我不擅长游泳。”“我也不会。”

en: "I'm just thinking about my wish," replied the little black rabbit.
zh: “我只是在想我的愿望，”小黑兔回答道。

en: "My father doesn't drink." "Neither does my father."
zh: “我爸爸不喝酒。”“我爸爸也不喝。”

en: "This is my first flight. I'm nervous," says Hiroshi.
zh: 浩史说：“这是我第一次坐飞机，我好紧张。”

en: What do you mean by cultural relativism?
zh: 你说的文化相对主义是什么意思？

en: "I've a touch of a cold." "That's too bad."
zh: “我有点感冒。”“那太糟糕了。”

en: "My husband passed on two years ago," an elderly lady said.
zh: 一位老太太说：“我丈夫两年前去世了。”

en: This is what he said: "I shall return by all means."
zh: 他是这么说的：“我无论如何都会回来的。”

en: The words 'beautiful' and 'ugly' are relative terms.
zh: “美”和“丑”是相对的概念。

en: "The accused" is a legal term.
zh: “被告”是一个法律术语。

en: Mary received an award for her composition called "Secret love".
zh: 玛丽凭借她的作品《暗恋》获奖了。

en: "Are you tired?" "No, not at all."
zh: “你累吗？”“不，一点儿都不累。”

en: "Is she reading a book?" "Yes, she is."
zh: “她在看书吗？”“嗯，在看。”

en: "Is she young?" "Yes, she is."
zh: “她年轻吗？”“对，挺年轻的。”

en: "Did she buy a watch?" "Yes, she bought one."
zh: “她买表了吗？”“嗯，买了一块。”

en: "Does she have a dog?" "No, she doesn't."
zh: “她养狗了吗？”“没有。”

en: "How old is she?" "She is twelve years old."
zh: “她多大了？”“十二岁。”

en: "She doesn't like music." "Nor do I."
zh: “她不喜欢音乐。”“我也不喜欢。”

en: "She likes music, doesn't she?" "So she does."
zh: “她喜欢音乐，不是吗？”“是啊，她确实喜欢。”

en: "How pretty she is!" said Ben to himself.
zh: 本心想：“她真漂亮啊！”

en: I said to myself, "I wonder what she means."
zh: 我心说：“我不知道她到底是什么意思。”

en: "Does she play tennis?" "Yes, she does."
zh: “她打网球吗？”“打。”

en: "She'll make it. I'm sure." "I'm just worried."
zh: “她肯定行，我确信。”“我就是有点担心。”

en: "She is lovely." "So she is."
zh: “她真可爱。”“确实。”

en: "Her charm is beyond description!" the artist exclaimed.
zh: 艺术家感叹道：“她的魅力简直无法用言语形容！”

en: "They left for New York, didn't they?" "Exactly."
zh: “他们去纽约了，是吧？”“没错。”

en: "Did they get the law passed?" "Yes, they finally put it through."
zh: “法律通过了吗？”“嗯，最后总算通过了。”

en: He denied knowing anything about their plans.
zh: 他否认对他们的计划知情。

en: "Do you think he will come?" "I hope not."
zh: “你觉得他会来吗？”“我希望他别来。”

en: "Is he coming?" "No, I think not."
zh: “他要来吗？”“不，我觉得他不来。”

en: "Is he going to swim tomorrow?" "Yes, he is."
zh: “他明天去游泳吗？”“嗯，去。”

en: "Who is he?" "He is Jim."
zh: “他是谁？”“他是吉姆。”

en: "Is he right?" "I don't think so."
zh: “他说得对吗？”“我觉得不对。”

en: "Will he succeed?" "I fear not."
zh: “他会成功吗？”“恐怕不行。”

en: "Is he by the car?" "No, he is in the car."
zh: “他在车旁边吗？”“不，他在车里。”

en: "Will he pass the examination?" "I am afraid not."
zh: “他能通过考试吗？”“恐怕通不过。”

en: "He'd like to have a coffee after work." "I would too."
zh: “他下班后想去喝杯咖啡。”“我也想去。”

en: "Did he write a letter yesterday?" "Yes, he did."
zh: “他昨天写信了吗？”“嗯，写了。”

en: "Does he like music?" "Yes, he does."
zh: “他喜欢音乐吗？”“嗯，喜欢。”

en: He doesn't come any more, the one smoking said.
zh: 那个抽烟的人说：“他不来了。”

en: "Will he come home soon?" "I'm afraid not."
zh: “他快到家了吗？”“恐怕还没。”

en: "Will he recover soon?" "I hope so."
zh: “他能很快康复吗？”“希望如此。”

en: "Will he recover soon?" "I'm afraid not."
zh: “他能很快康复吗？”“恐怕很难。”

en: "When does he study?" "He studies before dinner."
zh: “他什么时候学习？”“晚饭前。”

en: "Is his story true?" "I'm afraid not."
zh: “他说的是真的吗？”“恐怕不是。”

en: "Where's his book?" "It's on the table."
zh: “他的书呢？”“在桌子上。”

en: "His father died yesterday." "I have never seen such a man before."
zh: “他父亲昨天去世了。”“我以前从未见过这样的人。”

en: "Is he seriously ill?" "I hope not."
zh: “他病得很重吗？”“希望不是。”

en: "I know him well." "Oh, do you?"
zh: “我很了解他。”“噢，是吗？”

en: "I have to see him." "What for?"
zh: “我得见见他。”“干嘛去？”

en: Don't use "discover" when you mean "invent".
zh: 你想说“发明”的时候，别用“发现”这个词。

en: I asked her who the man wearing the white hat was.
zh: 我问她那个戴白帽子的人是谁。

en: "Natto" smells awful, but tastes delicious.

en: Get your hot dachshund sausages!
zh: 快来买热气腾腾的热狗肠啦！

en: "May I come in?" "Yes, certainly."

en: Japanese management must learn how to deal with American workers, he said.
zh: 他说，日本管理层必须学会如何与美国工人打交道。

en: "Road under Repair."

en: The bank robber shouted, "Stay where you are, all of you!"

zh: 所谓的“冬令时”有望推动大学改革。

en: "He's a tiger when he's angry" is an example of metaphor.
zh: “他生气时就像一只老虎”是隐喻的一个例子。

zh: “你可以在法院拿到它，”办事员补充道。

en: "Do you mind if I use your phone?" "No, please go ahead."

zh: “我可以用下您的电话吗？”“当然可以。”

en: "A stitch in time saves nine" is a proverb.

zh: 因为很喜欢《天路历程》，我收藏的第一批书是约翰·班扬的小册子合集。

en: "The weather forecast says it's cool today." "On the contrary, I feel hot."
